my_py_pkg.hardware_status_publisher module

class my_py_pkg.hardware_status_publisher.HardwareStatusPublisherNode[source]

Bases: Node

A ROS2 node that publishes hardware status messages at regular intervals.

This node is responsible for periodically publishing the status of hardware components to the ‘hardware_status’ topic using the HardwareStatus message type. It is intended to be used as a monitoring component within a ROS2 system, providing real-time updates about the hardware’s operational state.

hardware_status_publisher

The ROS2 publisher object used to send HardwareStatus messages on the ‘hardware_status’ topic.

Type:

Publisher

timer

A ROS2 timer that triggers the periodic execution of the publish_status method.

Type:

Timer

__init__()[source]

Initializes the node, sets up the publisher and timer, and logs a startup message.

publish_status()[source]

Callback function executed by the timer. Constructs a HardwareStatus message, sets its fields (e.g., are_motors_ready, debug_message), and publishes it to the ‘hardware_status’ topic.

publish_status()[source]
my_py_pkg.hardware_status_publisher.main(args=None)[source]

A ROS2 node that periodically publishes an integer value to the ‘number’ topic.

Type:

timer_period

The interval in seconds between publishes.

Type:

float

number_publisher

The ROS2 publisher for the ‘number’ topic.

Type:

Publisher

timer

The ROS2 timer that triggers periodic publishing.

Type:

Timer

Callback function that publishes the configured integer value to the ‘number’ topic.

my_py_pkg.robot_news_station module

class my_py_pkg.robot_news_station.RobotNewStationNode[source]

Bases: Node

A ROS2 node that publishes periodic news messages with a robot’s name.

This node declares two parameters:

  • ‘robot_name’ (str): The name of the robot to include in the news message. Default is “CP30”.

  • ‘timer’ (float): The interval in seconds between published messages. Default is 1.0.

robot_name

The name of the robot, retrieved from the ‘robot_name’ parameter.

Type:

str

timer

The timer interval, retrieved from the ‘timer’ parameter.

Type:

float

publisher_

Publishes String messages to the ‘robot_news’ topic.

Type:

Publisher

timer_

Calls the ‘publish_news’ method at the specified interval.

Type:

Timer

publish_news()[source]

Publishes a String message to the ‘robot_news’ topic containing the robot’s name.

publish_news()[source]
my_py_pkg.robot_news_station.main(args=None)[source]

my_py_pkg.smartphone module

class my_py_pkg.smartphone.SmartphoneNode[source]

Bases: Node

A ROS2 node that subscribes to the ‘robot_news’ topic and logs incoming messages.

This node is intended to simulate a smartphone device that receives news updates from a robot. Upon initialization, it creates a subscription to the ‘robot_news’ topic, expecting messages of type String. Whenever a new message is received, the callback_robot_news method is triggered, which logs the content of the message.

suscriber

The subscription object for the ‘robot_news’ topic.

Type:

Subscription

__init__()[source]

Initializes the SmartphoneNode, sets up the subscription, and logs a startup message.

callback_robot_news(msg

String): Callback function that logs the data received from the ‘robot_news’ topic.

Usage:

Instantiate this class within a ROS2 Python node to listen for and log robot news updates.

callback_robot_news(msg: String)[source]
my_py_pkg.smartphone.main(args=None)[source]
